title: Skarner Rework Idea
body:
So, to preface, I was a big fan of Skarner pre-juggernaut. I felt he was finally in a fair and playable spot. He had good strengths, obvious weaknesses, and no rediculous free-lo mechanics to complain about. He was simple, but still had room for skill expression with the use of his passive, and Q was still his main skill.

As of right now, Skarner has a pathetic passive that feels (to me) like a poor attempt at homage to a removed game mode (RIP dominion). The rest of his Kit is stacked onto his E skill, and his Q is a poorly scaling glorified Sheen proc. E has: Initial damage, slow, stun+damage on proc, passive bonuses for 1 second on proc (attack/move speed + mana regen), self-cooldown reduction on proc.

When thinking about how I would rework Skarner, I first thought about how his Q was his bread and butter skill, and in the description it reads, "Skarner charges himself with Crystal Energy..." and I thought, why not a unique resource for this champion? I also saw that they experimented with something similar when making Nasus (thanks Jeremy GamingCurious) so the idea wouldn't be too hard for Riot to implement. So here is the short version (no numbers) of my idea:

Passive is now Crystal Energy, Skarner's unique resource. Auto attacking and using Crystal Slash gather crystal energy. The more energy he has, the faster he moves/attacks. (up to a cap, obviously), Energy falls off as Skarner moves around and uses abilities other than Q.

Q: Same, gathers energy per enemy hit, does bonus magic damage while skarner has Crystal Energy available. While empowered, it still gathers energy per enemy hit, but costs 1 point of Energy as well.

W: Costs Crystal Energy, same shield and ramp up speed mechanic, speed breaks with shield. If shield lasts for the duration without breaking, refund a portion of the spent energy.

E: Costs Crystal Energy to fire, no longer slows missile speed as it passes through targets. Targets are marked, procing mark stuns enemy for 1 second and restores extra crystal energy.

R: Same effect: Skarner rapidly gains Crystal Energy over the duration of the suppression. Each rank in R prevents Skarner's Crystal Energy from dropping below a certain point through sheer movement. (Can still drop below threshold from using abilities.)

This is a round draft thought, but would love to hear your thoughts on it.

EDIT: I had also thought of adding a poison sting as a passive on his ultimate: Every 5th/4th/3rd strike is an attack with his stinger, which poisons his target, slowing for a short duration and dealing bonus magic damage based on the target's  health (haven't decided if current, missing or max would be most appropriate.)

EDIT 2: Food for thought:

"Skarner is a melee fighter. Who excels at not only dealing damage, but also controlling the battlefield. Utilizing basic attacks in addition to his abilities, Skarner is a true Hybrid fighter." ~Skarner Original Champion Spotlight

I think everyone who doesn't play Skarner has this misconception that his role is to "grab a carry and pull them into his team". In my opinion, this is dead wrong. Skarner is a pick fighter. He punishes bad positioning, sure, but he wants to stalk and catch his prey alone. In a team fight, he acts as a warden, peeling off divers and assassins. He is a single target specialist (in my opinion), a duelist, hunter, etc.

Also, Thank you :) <3
what you are saying of skarner was true.... before his last rework now the former is true as he has little to no damage to back up anything.

Problem is, the former is still false, because unless that carry is way out of position, Skarner has no access to the backlines excpet by flash... and then he still has to get back PAST the front line again...

Only way Skarner can "dive" is after someone else dives and parts the red sea known as the front line for him.

I mean, if you are going to define a champion by a single ability in his kit and also only define them by that ability's usefulness with a summoner spell, I think we did it wrong... :/

Skarner does not have to ult a carry. He can ult a mage to do the same thing he can ult a fighter / bruiser / juggernaut to do the same thing as long as it isnt a tank they wont survive his ult if his whole team focuses the target and if it is a tank if skarner has another tank in his team to zone he can ult the enemy tank have his tank zone and the enemy tank dies 2 seconds after he comes out of skarners ult. you then have a 4v5 and assumedly the enemy has no front line.

This is true, IF you built the comp around that. That being said, as far as the discourse of this particular conversation goes, the "former" specifically referred to his job as ulting a carry (be it a mage or marksman) who is likely behind their front line. As I have stated, Skarner is great for punishing bad positioining, regardless of the target, but that is more of a niche thing that his ult can do, and it is dependent on the enemy slipping up.

TLDR- Yes, Skarner can pull ANY champion who is out of position into his team for a focused kill, but that is not what was being discussed. If Skarner was supposed to ult a carry, mage or marksman, he would have to bypass the frontline, which he can't really do.

I just think he needs a different ult.

R- Crystalline Toxin
Instantly stings a target champion or Monster.
After 5seconds, the stung champion becomes a crystal statue for 5seconds and takes 15/25/35% of its maximum health as true damage over the 5seconds.
Target is immune to all other sources of damage, and cannot be healed or shielded.
When using on Monsters, deals 1500 True damage.

Currently his role is to grab a squishy and pull them into death.
Not a reasonable role given his kit. He cant do it.

I would want to shift his role into being a Anti-Tank, Tank.
He aims to sting the tank, removing the tank from the equation for 5seconds, so that your team can freely fight.
Also, 35% max health true damage on a tank would be effective.

I respectfully disagree. Skarner's Ult is iconic to him. They just need to stop trying to make him an initiator tank, and put him back to being a duelist/hunter. He plays more like a skirmisher honestly. As a tank, however, hes really a warden, not a vanguard.

EDIT: Also, I am a huge advocate against %MAX HP TRUE DAMAGE... There is no counter to it, no way to build against it. 35% max HP true damage is effective vs squishies as well as tanks...

Remember, his title was given back in the day when "Vanguard" wasn't a term they used to define sub classes of tanks. Skarner was a "fighter", in the day that "fighter" simply meant a melee damage dealer.

Old School Terms:

Tank: Melee Damage soaker- front line initiator/backline peelers
Fighter: Melee Damage Dealer
Mage: AP spell slinger, focused on burst and utility
Marksmen: Ranged damage dealer


If Skarner was made today with the same general concept as his initial creation, he would be a Slayer- Skirmisher. He excels at dealing sustained damage and chasing/locking down single targets. He's a hunter. He's after the jerks who took his brothers' crystals, and he will kill them all... one at a time... as he finds them...

Like any other Skirmisher, he has some other situational utility to offer, since if he is not even or ahead, he can't really duel efficiently:

Fiora- Front line killer- Her %MAX HP True damage can kill a front line tank quickly. The heal from her ultimate makes it where fighting the tank first is less punishing.

Yasuo- Zone control with Windwall

Skarner can play like a Warden, peeling off divers and assassins with his single target lockdown.

I don't think they should "transform" Skarner again... he should be reverted back to what he was supposed to be. A duelist, hybrid fighter.

Thats my opinion.

I prefer him more oriented to the tank class specifically as a Vanguard. But I also enjoy play him as a Juggernaut/Skirmisher hybrid thing with tons of AD. This new buff can put him in a good position. Thats whats I hope.

M7 Skarner main here (one of the 3 of us):

Honestly one of the simplest and most effective changes would be to make his W scale off AD instead of AP.  There is honestly no reason to ever build AP on skarner so I'm not sure why they make all of his abilities scale off it.  But if they at least made his W scale off AD, you'd be able to dedicate more gold to damage items while still maintaining some late-game tankiness when you activate your W. 

I actually like his passive the way that it is.   The crystals in the camps and river make jungle clears fast and easy.  I do like your idea of doing something fun with his resource and Q management. The way that it is now is sort of gimmicky... I'd like to see the crystal energy stack, up to 4 or 5 or 6 times, and fall off one at a time so you could carry a few from the jungle into the lanes.  It would give you better early ganks pre-6.

Having his Shield scale with AD is a bad idea in my opinion. Skarner is one of the few champions left who can truly benefit from both AD and AP in a meaningful way.

His passive is a terrible gimmik, and is the reason he is trash right now. The fact that a LARGE portion of his power budget can be completely denied is just terrible design.
